page.title: 07Llangunllo Trade
page.content: The single shop and the nearby Post Office occupy a central position in the village;not only geographicaly but also in the daily life of the community.The shop, run by it's owner, sells a wide variety of groceries and small household goods as well as providing bread to order three times a week.Some greengrocery and fruit is availible, besides a range of tobacco products and caifectionary.Daily papers are sold to order.It is, in it's own way a forerunner of the supermarket especially during bad winters when isolation makes it then sole supplier of neccessities for a wide area, reaching well outside the survey area.It also acts as a noticeboard for local events.The Post Office provides stamps, postal orders and pays pensions and allowances.The pub, The Greyhound, sells petrol.
